swen221.tetris.tetromino

Class StickyTetromino

  • java.lang.Object
    • swen221.tetris.tetromino.StickyTetromino
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino

    public class StickyTetromino
extends java.lang.Object
implements swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino
    Represents a tetromino which can only perform one rotation operation.
    Author:
    David J. Pearce, Marco Servetto

      • isWithin

        public boolean isWithin(int x,
                        int y)
        Description copied from interface: swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino
        Check whether a given coordinate on the board is within this tetromino. That is, whether or not it is one of the locations making up this tetromino. This method is used, for example, when drawing a tetrmoino. That is, we first acquire the bounding box for the tetromino and then employ this method to determine which cells are actually within the tetromino. This method can also be used to check whether a given tetromino overlaps with another, etc.
        Specified by:
        isWithin in interface swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position being checked for membership within this tetromino.
        y - The y-coordinate of the position being checked for membership within this tetromino.
        Returns:

      • getBoundingBox

        public swen221.tetris.logic.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
        Description copied from interface: swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino
        Get the bounding box of this tetromino. The bounding box is the smallest rectangle which fully encloses the tetromino.
        Specified by:
        getBoundingBox in interface swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino
        Returns:

      • rotate

        public swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino rotate(int steps)
        Description copied from interface: swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino
        Rotate this tetromino a given number of steps in a clockwise or anti-clockwise direction.
        Specified by:
        rotate in interface swen221.tetris.tetromino.Tetromino
        Parameters:
        steps - Number of steps to rotate in clockwise direction, where negative values go in the anti-clockwise direction.
